isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ DT, 9 and 10 Engine Service Manual - Cylinder Head and Valve Train - Recondition - Install Valves

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, wear safety glasses with side shields. Limit compressed air pressure to 207 kPa (30 psi).

step1.para: Clean valve faces and seats with a suitable solvent. Dry all components using filtered compressed air.

To clean valve guides, coat a brush with soap and water. Insert brush into each valve guide bore and rotate in one direction with an up and down motion. Dry valve guide bores using filtered compressed air.
Insert a large nylon brush in the rear of the fuel rail gallery to loosen dirt and deposits. Blow out debris using filtered compressed air.

figure.caption: Valve stem seal, spring, and rotator

step1.para: Lubricate valve stem with clean engine oil and insert valve in valve guide.
Lubricate inside diameter of new valve stem seals with clean engine oil. Install seals over valve stems and valve guides. Make sure seals are completely seated against cylinder head spring pockets.
Install valve springs over valve stem seals.

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, rotators must be installed on intake valves.

step1.para: Install valve rotators on top of intake valve springs. Install valve rotators or retainers on top of exhaust valve springs.

figure.caption: Valve Spring Compressor and retainer keys

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, wear safety glasses with side shields to protect eyes.

step1.para:
Install Valve Spring Compressor
over valve and compress valve spring.
Install valve spring retainer keys and release spring compressor.
